intro: Broussonetia elegans, commonly known as the elegant broussonetia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by elongated, bean-like pods containing several seeds. Broussonetia elegans is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
